alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 4:51AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG AND FREEZING FOG THIS MORNING... At 440 AM, areas of dense fog were developing across the valleys of southwest Washington and northwest Oregon, including along portions of Interstate 5. Visibility of one half mile or less has been common in the fog, with localized visibility as low as a couple hundred feet or less. With temperatures near or a little below freezing, areas of frost and freezing fog are occurring as well. Visibility varies dramatically throughout the southwest Washington and northwest Oregon. Drivers should be prepared for sudden changes in visibility and road conditions. Frosty roads will provide an additional challenge for drivers, cyclists, and pedestrians. Cyclists and pedestrians should consider wearing bright or reflective clothing to increase the chances of being seen by others.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Coast
